children.name: Annotation type
children.definition: Category/class of the annotations (metadata) that are added to the data/text that is processed

children.name: Term
children.definition: A term is a designation consisting of one or more words representing a general concept in a special language in a specific subject field [ISO 704:2009]

children.name: Semantic annotation type
children.definition: Any type of annotation pertaining to the semantic level

children.name: Polarity
children.definition: A feature that distinguishes between positive, negative or neutral; in sentiment analysis, it refers to determining whether the expressed opinion in a document, a sentence or an entity feature/aspect is positive, negative, or neutral. [adapted from Wikipedia]

children.name: Persuasive expression
children.definition: A word or phrase used for persuasion purposes

children.name: Semantic role
children.definition: A semantic role is the underlying relationship that a participant has with the main verb in a clause [http://www.glossary.sil.org/term/semantic-role]

children.name: Certainty level
children.definition: Degree of certainty about the validity of what is being asserted in the text

children.name: Named entity
children.definition: A word or phrase referring to an entity, identified and annotated as such with a name (label); examples include organizations, persons, places etc.

children.name: Facility
children.definition: A human-made artifact in the domains of architecture and civil engineering [source: https://www.nltk.org/book/ch07.html]

children.name: Ionic current
children.definition: The influx and/or efflux of ions through an ion channel

children.name: Model organism/species
children.definition: Model organism/species

children.name: Biological activity
children.definition: Biological activity

children.name: Scientific unit
children.definition: Scientific unit

children.name: Brain region
children.definition: Part of the brain

children.name: Official text
children.definition: Official text

children.name: Date
children.definition: A text unit that denotes a date, a specific point in time

children.name: Metabolite
children.definition: Any substance involved in metabolism (= the chemical processes in the body needed for life) [https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/metabolite]

children.name: Chemical
children.definition: Any substance (as an acid) that is formed when two or more other substances act upon one another or that is used to produce a change in another substance [https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/chemical]

children.name: Geo-political entity
children.definition: A geographical area associated with some sort of political structure

children.name: Location
children.definition: A word or group of words that denotes a geographical entity

children.name: Neuron
children.definition: A nerve cell that carries information between the brain and other parts of the body

children.name: Organization
children.definition: A word or group of words that denotes an organization, such as company, association, institution etc.

children.name: Media
children.definition: The main means of mass communication (broadcasting, publishing, and the Internet) regarded collectively [https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/media]

children.name: Species
children.definition: A set of animals or plants in which the members have similar characteristics to each other and can breed with each other

children.name: Wheat-related species
children.definition: Wheat-related species

children.name: Theoretical frame
children.definition: Theoretical frame

children.name: Spectral data
children.definition: Spectral data is essentially data derived by the use of spectroscopic instruments

children.name: Miscellaneous
children.definition: A general label for named entities other than the usual ones recognized by a system

children.name: Method of research
children.definition: Method of research

children.name: Person
children.definition: A word or group of words that refers to a person

children.name: Scientific value
children.definition: Scientific value

children.name: Synapse
children.definition: A specialized structure or junction that allows cell to cell communication [http://www.biology-online.org/dictionary/Synapse]

children.name: Protein
children.definition: Any of various naturally occurring extremely complex substances that consist of amino-acid residues joined by peptide bonds, contain the elements carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen, oxygen, usually sulfur, and occasionally other elements (such as phosphorus or iron), and include many essential biological compounds (such as enzymes, hormones, or antibodies) [https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/protein]

children.name: Ionic conductance
children.definition: Ionic conductance

children.name: Ionic channel
children.definition: A single protein or protein complex that traverses the lipid bilayer of cell membrane and form a channel to facilitate the movement of ions through the membrane according to their electrochemical gradient [http://www.biology-online.org/dictionary/Ion_channel]

children.name: Historical event
children.definition: Historical event

children.name: Topic
children.definition: The subject of a text or conversation, what it is about

children.name: Temporal expression
children.definition: A linguistic expression (word, group of words, group of numbers etc.) that denotes time (a point in time, duration, frequency)

children.name: Subjectivity
children.definition: The linguistic expression of somebody’s opinions, sentiments, emotions, evaluations, beliefs, speculations (private states, i.e. states that are not open to objective observation or verification). [http://www.mavir.net/docs/JWiebe-Subjectivity-nov2010.pdf]

children.name: Lexical semantic relation
children.definition: A relation holding between two or more words based on their meanings

children.name: Syntactico-semantic link
children.definition: A link between the syntactic unit and the semantic unit (sense) of a word

children.name: Semantic class
children.definition: A division of words into classes based on their common semantic features

children.name: Keyword
children.definition: A word or group of words used to describe or index the contents of a document

children.name: Word sense
children.definition: Corresponds to the structural part of a lexical entry that contains the relevant semantic, grammatical, and anthropological information for a lexical unit. [adapted from http://www.glossary.sil.org/term/sense]

children.name: Readability
children.definition: The ease with which a reader can understand a written text. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Readability]

children.name: Event
children.definition: A thing that happens or takes place, especially one of importance [https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/event]

children.name: Emotion
children.definition: An affective state of consciousness in which joy, sorrow, fear, hate, or the like, is experienced, as distinguished from cognitive and volitional states of consciousness [http://www.dictionary.com/browse/emotion]

children.name: Semantic frame
children.definition: A schematic representation of a situation involving various participants, props and other conceptual roles, each of which is a frame element

children.name: Sentiment
children.definition: The affective state (judgement, feeling) of a person or group towards an entity or event

children.name: Question Topical Target
children.definition: The segment of a question that describes the entity about which the question is made

children.name: Structural annotation type
children.definition: Any type of annotation that pertains to the structure of a document

children.name: Phrase
children.definition: A phrase is a syntactic structure that consists of more than one word but lacks the subject-predicate organization of a clause. [http://www.glossary.sil.org/term/phrase]

children.name: Token
children.definition: A set of characters surrounded by spaces or punctuation marks, as well as punctuation marks themselves

children.name: Document section
children.definition: Any subdivision of a document, e.g. a chapter, abstract, etc.

children.name: Multi-word unit
children.definition: A combination of words that are considered as forming one semantic unit

children.name: Clause
children.definition: A clause is a subdivision of a sentence containing a subject (argument) and predicate. It is possible to have a word that implies or refers to a predicate rather than one explicitly stated. [Pei & Gaynor 1980: 40, http://linguistics-ontology.org/gold/2010/Clause]

children.name: Paragraph
children.definition: A division of a text, usually about a single theme, consisting of one or more sentences and marked by a new line, indentation or other conventions.

children.name: Sentence
children.definition: A group of words, usually containing a verb, that expresses a thought in the form of a statement, question, instruction, or exclamation and starts with a capital letter when written [https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/sentence]

children.name: Word
children.definition:
A word is a unit which is a constituent at the phrase level and above. It is sometimes identifiable according to such criteria as (a) being the minimal possible unit in a reply, (b) having features such as a regular stress pattern, and phonological changes conditioned by or blocked at word boundaries, (c) being the largest unit resistant to insertion of new constituents within its boundaries, or (d) being the smallest constituent that can be moved within a sentence without making the sentence ungrammatical. A word is sometimes placed, in a hierarchy of grammatical constituents, above the morpheme level and below the phrase level. [http://www.glossary.sil.org/term/word]
In annotation, words are often used as equivalent to tokens; thus, for instance, punctuation marks (traditionally not considered as words) will also be annotated as "word".

children.name: Domain-specific annotation type
children.definition: Any kind of annotation that is used for specific domains (e.g. genes and proteins from the biomedical domain, plants from agriculture etc.)

children.name: Agricultural entity
children.definition: Any kind of annotation pertaining to entities of the agricultural domain; the use of the AGROVOC thesaurus is recommended

children.name: Marker
children.definition: Marker

children.name: Gene
children.definition: Specific sequence of nucleotides along a molecule of DNA (or, in the case of some viruses, RNA) which represents functional units of heredity [http://artemide.art.uniroma2.it:8081/agrovoc/agrovoc/en/page/c_3214]

children.name: Habitat
children.definition: The place or environment where an organism, plant or animal naturally or normally lives and grows

children.name: RNA
children.definition: Any of various nucleic acids that contain ribose and uracil as structural components and are associated with the control of cellular chemical activities

children.name: Organism
children.definition: An individual animal, plant, or single-celled life form [https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/organism]

children.name: Wheat-related species
children.definition: Wheat-related species

children.name: Physico-chemical property
children.definition: Physical and chemical property of substances

children.name: Protein family
children.definition: A protein family is a group of proteins that share a common evolutionary origin, reflected by their related functions and similarities in sequence or structure [https://www.ebi.ac.uk/training/online/course/introduction-protein-classification-ebi/protein-classification/what-are-protein-families]

children.name: Gene family
children.definition: A gene family is a set of several similar genes, formed by duplication of a single original gene, and generally with similar biochemical functions [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene_family]

children.name: Grape variety
children.definition: A type of grape

children.name: Phenotype
children.definition: The physical appearance or biochemical characteristic of an organism as a result of the interaction of its genotype and the environment [http://www.biology-online.org/dictionary/Phenotype]

children.name: Linguistic entity
children.definition: Any kind of annotation pertaining to entities of linguistics; the use of OLIA is recommended

children.name: Scientific unit
children.definition: Scientific unit

children.name: Social sciences entity
children.definition: Any kind of annotation that pertains to entities of social sciences; the use of TheSoz is recommended

children.name: Official text
children.definition: Official text

children.name: Media
children.definition: The main means of mass communication (broadcasting, publishing, and the Internet) regarded collectively [https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/media]

children.name: Theoretical frame
children.definition: Theoretical frame

children.definition: ALLBUS variable

children.definition: Historical event

children.name: Neuroscience entity
children.definition: Any kind of annotation pertaining to entities of neuroscience

children.name: Scholarly analytics entity
children.definition: Any type of annotation that is relevant to scholarly analtyics (e.g. citations, funding information etc.)

children.name: Document section
children.definition: Any subdivision of a document, e.g. a chapter, abstract, etc.

children.name: Topic
children.definition: The subject of a text or conversation, what it is about

children.name: Citation
children.definition: Reference to a book, paper, or author, especially in a scholarly work.

children.definition: A word or group of words used to describe or index the contents of a document

children.name: Funding

children.name: Syntactic annotation type
children.definition: Any type of annotation that pertains to the syntactic level

children.name: Chunk
children.definition: Group of words that function together; a chunk normally includes a head and some consecutive (i.e. without gaps) preceding words

children.name: Syntactico-semantic link
children.definition: A link between the syntactic unit and the semantic unit (sense) of a word

children.name: Dependency tree
children.definition: A tree that represents the dependency relations in a sentence, i.e. showing the governor (head) and its dependents with directed links

children.name: Subcategorization frame
children.definition: The number and types of syntactic arguments required by a certain lexical item (mainly verbs, but also nouns and adjectives)

children.name: Dependency
children.definition: A type of syntactic relation that holds between linguistic units, where we try to recognise the head (governor) and its dependents

children.name: Constituency tree
children.definition: An ordered, rooted tree that represents the syntactic structure of a string according to a constituency grammar (= phrase structure grammars). It distinguishes between terminal and non-terminal nodes. The interior nodes are labeled by non-terminal categories of the grammar (phrases), while the leaf nodes are labeled by terminal categories (parts of speech). [adapted from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parse_tree]

children.name: Constituent
children.definition: A word or group of words that function as a single unit in a syntactic structure

children.name: Discourse annotation type
children.definition: Any type of annotation relevant to discourse

children.name: Audience reaction
children.definition: The response of the target recipients (audience) to a system, process or event

children.name: Discource relation
children.definition: The relation that holds between two segments of discourse; e.g. causal, temporal etc.

children.name: Coreference
children.definition: Coreference is the reference in one expression to the same referent in another expression. [http://www.glossary.sil.org/term/coreference]

children.name: Entity-Mention pair
children.definition: The pair of an entity and all the mentions of this entity formulated in various ways; used in co-reference resolution

children.name: Contradiction
children.definition: A set of statements that contradict each other (i.e. one of them asserts the truth and the other the falsity of the proposition)

children.name: Speech act
children.definition: A speech act is an act that a speaker performs when making an utterance, including the following: (a) A general act (illocutionary act) that a speaker performs, analyzable as including: the uttering of words (utterance acts), making reference and predicating (propositional acts), and a particular intention in making the utterance (illocutionary force). (b) An act involved in the illocutionary act, including utterance acts and propositional acts, (c) The production of a particular effect in the addressee (perlocutionary act) [http://www.glossary.sil.org/term/speech-act]

children.name: Dialogue act
children.definition: A dialogue act has two main components:  a communicative function and a semantic content.   The semantic content specifies the objects, relations, actions, events, etc. that the dialogue act is about; the communicative function can be viewed as a specification of the way an addressee uses the semantic content to update his or her information state when  he  or  she  understands  the  corresponding  stretch  of dialogue. [http://www.lrec-conf.org/proceedings/lrec2010/pdf/560_Paper.pdf]

children.name: Part of Speech
children.definition: A division of words based on common grammatical features

children.name: Document annotation type
children.definition: Any kind of annotation that is used to describe a document (e.g. identifier, size, location, language etc.)

children.name: Morphological annotation type
children.definition: Any type of annotation pertaining to the morphological level

children.name: Lemma
children.definition: The canonical or citation form used for referring to a word and its inflected forms

children.name: Compound
children.definition: A single word composed of two or more free morphemes

children.name: Derivational feature
children.definition: Any feature relevant to the derivation process of a word (e.g. marking affixes, their meaning etc.)

children.name: Morphological feature
children.definition: Property of a word that is expressed in its inflected form; examples include person, tense, gender, case etc.

children.name: Stem
children.definition: A stem is the root or roots of a word, together with any derivational affixes, to which inflectional affixes are added. [http://www.glossary.sil.org/term/stem]

A word is sometimes placed, in a hierarchy of grammatical constituents, above the morpheme level and below the phrase level. [http://www.glossary.sil.org/term/word]

children.name: Alignment
children.definition: The translational equivalent between structural units (words, sentences etc.) of a text in a given language and a text with similar meaning in other language(s)

children.name: Component type
children.definition: Specifies the type of a component, in terms of the function/task it performs

children.name: Access Component
children.definition: A component that provides access to data resources, e.g. reads a resource or writes the output of a process in a certain format

children.name: Writer
children.definition: A component that writes processing results in various formats

children.name: Reader
children.definition: A component that reads content of various types (pdf, txt, xml etc.)

children.name: Support component
children.definition: A component that provides support to developers

children.name: Data merger
children.definition: A component that supports data merging from various sources

children.name: Machine Learning predictor
children.definition: A component that is used in predicting based on machine learning models

children.name: Matcher
children.definition: A component that allows matching of elements

children.name: Gazeteer based matcher
children.definition: A component that allows matching of elements based on a gazeteer

children.name: Data collector
children.definition: A component that collects (retrieves) data from various sources

children.name: Crawler
children.definition: A component that crawls the web and collects data from various web sites

children.name: Editor
children.definition: A component that allows humans to edit the contents of a resource

children.name: Crowdsourcing component
children.definition: A component that supports crowdsourcing operations

children.name: Converter
children.definition: A component that performs conversion between formats of a resource

children.name: Dependency converter
children.definition: A component that converts a constituency tree into a dependency tree

children.name: Validator
children.definition: A component used to confirm that a system/resource meets the specifications and fulfills its intended purpose

children.name: Trainer of Machine Learning models
children.definition: A component that is used in training models for machine learning

children.name: Software development environment
children.definition: A technology that supports the development of software components and data resources required for their operation

children.name: Flow controller
children.definition: A component that supports controlling flows

children.name: Viewer
children.definition: A component that supports humans in accessing the contents of a resource

children.name: Corpus viewer
children.definition: A component that supports humans in accessing the contents of a corpus

children.name: Lexicon viewer
children.definition: A component that supports humans in accessing the contents of a lexical/conceptual resource

children.name: Visualiser
children.definition: A component or interface that renders the contents of a resource in a graphic way for visualisation purposes

children.name: Script-based analyser
children.definition: A component that performs analysis tasks based on a script

children.name: Evaluator
children.definition: A component that is used in the evaluation of the performance of a component

children.name: Debugger
children.definition: A component that is used in the debugging process

children.name: Feature extractor
children.definition: A component that is used for extracting features

children.name: Data splitter
children.definition: A component that performs data splitting for cross validation purposes

children.name: Pre- or Post-Processor
children.definition: A component that is used at pre- or post-processing stages in order to normalize input/output

children.name: Grammar checker
children.definition: A component that corrects grammatical mistakes in a text

children.name: Spelling checker
children.definition: A component that corrects spelling mistakes in a text

children.name: Filter
children.definition: A component that is used for filtering text input or annotations based on specific criteria

children.name: Normalizer
children.definition: A component that removes unwanted material from text (e.g. quotation marks, hyphenations etc.) or performs edits so that specific items (tokens, dates,  etc.) are substituted/represented with normalized values

children.name: Processor
children.definition: A component that is used in processing operations

children.name: Generator
children.definition: A component that generates (semi-)automatically natural language texts (based on non-linguistic data, keywords, logical forms, knowledge bases...)

children.name: Summarizer
children.definition: A component that produces a natural language synopsis of a longer text

children.name: Simplifier
children.definition: A component that outputs a simpler rendition of a given item (sentence, text etc.)

children.name: Annotator
children.definition: A component that annotates any data (text, video, audio etc.), i.e. adds any descriptive or analytic notations (structural, linguistic, etc) to raw data

children.name: Lemmatizer
children.definition: A component that annotates the tokens of a text with lemma information

children.name: Morphological tagger
children.definition: A component that annotates tokens of a text with morphological information (part-of-speech and morphological features)

children.name: Part of speech tagger
children.definition: A component that annotates tokens of a text with part-of-speech information

children.name: Named entitity recognizer
children.definition: A component that seeks to locate and classify elements in a text into pre-defined categories such as the names of persons, organizations, locations, expressions of times, discipline-specific classes, etc

children.name: Semantic annotator
children.definition: A component that annotates the tokens of a text with semantic features

children.name: Readability annotator
children.definition: A component that annotates the tokens of a text with readability scores

children.name: Annotator of semantic role labels
children.definition: A component that annotates the tokens of a text with Semantic Role labels

children.name: Co-reference annotator
children.definition: A component that annotates tokens of a text with coreference labels, marking expressions that refer to the same entity in the text

children.name: Chunker
children.definition: A component that groups tokens of a text into chunks

children.name: Stemmer
children.definition: A component that extracts stems from words in a text, usually by removing the most common morphological and inflectional endings from words

children.name: Parser
children.definition: A component that takes as input text and returns a form of data structure (e.g. syntactic parse as a tree, or bracketed structure etc.)

children.name: Dependency parser
children.definition: A component that generates a dependency tree from typically token and part-of-speech annotations

children.name: Constituency parser
children.definition: A component that builds a constituency tree from typically token and part-of-speech annotations

children.name: Aligner
children.definition: A component that detects and annotates equivalence relations between items (corpora, texts, paragraphs, sentences, phrases, words) in two languages

children.name: Segmenter
children.definition: A component that segments a text into structural untis (chapters, paragraphs, sentences, words, tokens etc.)

children.name: Sentence splitter
children.definition: A component that splits a text into sentences

children.name: Tokenizer
children.definition: A component that recognizes and tags tokens (words, punctuation marks, digits etc.) in a text

children.name: Analyzer
children.definition: A component that is used for analyzing an input text in order to extract specific features/information (e.g. word list), or to produce statements over the whole text (e.g. classify it by topic)

children.name: Lexicon extractor from lexica
children.definition: A component that extracts specific lexical information contained in other lexica

children.name: Variables dectector
children.definition: A component that tries to identify variables (in social sciences) in a text

children.name: Sentiment analyzer
children.definition: A component that tries to identify sentences that express the author’s negative or positive feelings on something

children.name: Contradiction detector
children.definition: A component that tries to automatically recognize elements that reveal contradiction in a text

children.name: Keyword extractor
children.definition: A component that tries to extract keywords from a given text

children.name: Emotion recognizer
children.definition: A component that tries to recognize and annotate emotions (e.g. fear, anger, happiness etc.) from text, video, audio and image

children.name: Document classifier
children.definition: A component that tries to classify a document into one or more categories

children.name: Persuasive expression miner
children.definition: A component that tries to identify persuasive expressions in a given text

children.name: Lexicon extractor from corpora
children.definition: A component that extracts lexical information from corpora in order to produce structured lexical resources

children.name: Information extractor
children.definition: A component that automatically extracts structured information from unstructured and/or semi-structured machine-readable documents

children.name: Term extractor
children.definition: A component that tries to extract terms from a corpus

children.name: Topic extractor
children.definition: A component that guesses the topic of a text

children.name: Event extractor
children.definition: A component that tries to extract information related to incidents referred to in a text

children.name: Language identifier
children.definition: A component that identifies the language of a given text based on its contents

children.name: Disambiguator
children.definition: A component that is used to disambiguate between two or more ambiguous items

children.name: Word sense disambiguator
children.definition: A component that tries to identify which sense of a word (i.e. meaning) is used in a sentence, when the word has multiple meanings

children.name: CoNLL format

children.name: CoNLL-2000
children.definition: The CoNLL 2000 format represents POS and Chunk tags. Fields in a line are separated by spaces. Sentences are separated by a blank new line.

children.name: CoNLL-2008
children.definition: The CoNLL 2008 format targets syntactic and semantic dependencies. Columns are tab-separated. Sentences are separated by a blank new line.

children.name: CoNLL-2003
children.definition: The CoNLL 2004 format encodes named entity spans and chunk spans. Fields are separated by a single space. Sentences are separated by a blank new line. Named entities and chunks are encoded in the IOB1 format. I.e. a B prefix is only used if the category of the following span differs from the category of the current span.

children.name: CoNLL-2009
children.definition: The CoNLL 2009 format targets semantic role labeling. Columns are tab-separated. Sentences are separated by a blank new line.

children.name: CoNLL-U
children.definition: Format used for CoNLL.

children.name: CoNLL-2006
children.definition: The CoNLL 2006 (aka CoNLL-X) format targets dependency parsing. Columns are tab-separated. Sentences are separated by a blank new line.

children.name: CoNLL-2002
children.definition: The CoNLL 2002 format encodes named entity spans. Fields are separated by a single space. Sentences are separated by a blank new line.

children.name: CoNLL-2012
children.definition: The CoNLL 2012 format targets semantic role labeling and coreference. Columns are tab-separated. Sentences are separated by a blank new line.

children.definition: Data format for Microsoft Access database

children.definition: A compressed binary encoding of GATE XML

children.definition: The NAF format is linguistic annotation format designed for complex NLP pipelines. NAF combines strengths of the Linguistic Annotation Framework (LAF) as described in Ide et al. (2003) and the NLP Interchange Format (Hellman et al. 2013, NIF).

children.name: TMX
children.definition: The purpose of the TMX format is to provide a standard method to describe translation memory data that is being exchanged among tools and/or translation vendors, while introducing little or no loss of critical data during the process.
