children.name: Scholarly communication
children.definition: Scholarly communication can be defined as “the system through which research and other scholarly writings are created, evaluated for quality, disseminated to the scholarly community, and preserved for future use. The system includes both formal means of communication, such as publication in peer-reviewed journals, and informal channels, such as electronic listservs.” (Association of College & Research Libraries, “Principles and Strategies for the Reform of Scholarly Communication 1,” 2003)

children.name: Mimetype
children.definition: The IANA mimetype that can be used for the data format; it can be the exact or a broader mimetype; unofficial mimetypes are also used, but this will be revisited

children.name: Operation
children.definition: The action that a software program performs or is meant to perform

children.name: Evaluation
children.definition: The task/process of assessing the quality of a resource, e.g. based on the contents (for a dataset) or performance (for a tool or service)

children.name: Deep parser performance evaluation
children.definition: The task/process of measuring the speed and accuracy of deep parsers with respect to a manually parsed test corpus.

children.name: Evaluation of broad-coverage natural language parsers
children.definition: The task/process of assessing the quality performance of parsers

children.name: Evaluation of Machine Translation and translation tools
children.definition: The task/process of assessing the quality performance of machine translation tools

children.name: Translation
children.definition: The task/process of expressing the sense of a sequence of words in one language into another language

children.name: Image translation
children.definition: The automatic extraction of text contained in an image (e.g. by OCR technology), its subsequent translation into another language, followed by a digital image processing step in order to reconstruct the original image with the translated text [adapted from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image_translation]

children.name: Localization
children.definition: The process of adapting a product or content to a specific locale or market, including translation of relevant language material but also converting to local measures and currency units, modifications necessary to adapt to cultural differences of the target audience, etc. [adapted from https://www.gala-global.org/industry/intro-language-industry/what-localization]

children.name: Machine Translation
children.definition: The automatic translation of a text from one language into another performed by software without human involvement

children.name: Computer-aided translation
children.definition: A form of translation performed by a human translator with the aid of software programmes

children.name: Human Aided Machine Translation
children.definition: The process of performing Machine Translation facilitated by pre-editing or post-editing steps, or interactive human intervention to steer or select from alternative translations

children.name: Machine translation support
children.definition: Any operation that can be used for training or support of Machine Translation tools

children.name: Parallel sentence extraction
children.definition: The task/process of identifying parallel sentences (i.e. sentences that have the same sense in different languages) in parallel texts

children.name: Alignment
children.definition: Establishment of translational equivalences between structural units (words, sentences etc.) of a text in a given language and a text with similar meaning in other language(s)

children.name: Sentence alignment
children.definition: Alignment at sentence level

children.name: Word alignment
children.definition: Alignment at word level

children.name: Phrase alignment
children.definition: Alignment at phrase level

children.name: Speech-to-Speech translation
children.definition: The process by which spoken utterances in one language are automatically translated and spoken aloud in another language

children.name: Text and Data Analytics
children.definition: The process/task of converting unstructured text and data into high-quality structured data that can be further analysed to extract knowledge, support decision making etc.

children.name: Text and Data Mining
children.definition: The automated processing of unstructured text and/or structured data leading to the extraction of previously hidden knowledge.

children.name: Knowledge acquisition
children.definition: The process/task of extracting, organising and systematising knowledge usually of a specific domain from external sources so that it can be used in a knowledge-based system

children.name: Lexicon enhancement
children.definition: The task/process of improving (e.g. increasing the size of entries, improving the information, adding new types of information, etc.) a lexicon

children.name: Lexicon extraction from lexica
children.definition: The task/process of constructing lexical resources based on the restructuring of lexical information contained in lexica (e.g. by parsing definitions or using syntactic information attached to lemmas)

children.name: Bilingual lexicon induction
children.definition: The task/process of inducing word translations from monolingual or comparable corpora in two languages

children.name: Ontology enhancement
children.definition: The task/process of improving an ontology, typically by adding new relations or entities

children.name: Lexicon acquisition from corpora
children.definition: The task/process of constructing lexical resources from corpora

children.name: Ontology acquisition
children.definition: The task/process of creating an ontology based on other resources (corpora, other lexical resources, etc.)

children.name: Information Extraction
children.definition: The process/task of automatically extracting structured information from unstructured and/or semi-structured data

children.name: Automatic hyperlinking
children.definition: The identification of hyperlinkable entities (concepts, named entities) in a text and the assignment of hyperlinks (link targets) for each such entity.

children.name: Recognizing Textual Entailment
children.definition: A task/process that intends to recognize for two text fragments whether the meaning of one text is entailed in that of the other, i.e. whether the truth of one text fragment follows from that of the other fragment.

children.name: Truth labelling
children.definition: The task of assigning a true/false tag to a news item, headline, claim, etc.

children.name: Fake news detection
children.definition: The process of detecting whether a certain news item is fake (i.e. a type of news items of yellow journalism or propaganda that consists of deliberate disinformation or hoaxes spread via traditional news media or online social media) [adapted from wikipedia]

children.name: Relation Extraction
children.definition: The process/task of identifying and classifying relation mentions between entities in text and/or data.

children.name: Fact checking
children.definition: The act of checking factual assertions in non-fictional text in order to determine the veracity and correctness of the factual statements in the text [from Wikipedia]

children.name: Keyword extraction
children.definition: The task/process of identifying keywords (words deemed indicative of the topic/subject) in a text/corpus

children.name: Text categorization
children.definition: The task/process of assigning documents into classes or categories

children.name: Topic Detection
children.definition: The task/process of identifying the topic of a text or dataset (e.g. by clustering keywords or using topic models)

children.name: Sentiment analysis
children.definition: The process/task of computationally identifying and categorizing opinions expressed in a piece of text, especially in order to determine whether the writer's attitude towards a particular topic, product, etc. is positive, negative, or neutral

children.name: Text similarity assessment
children.definition: The task of determining the degree of closeness between two pieces of text

children.name: Humour detection
children.definition: The task of identifying in a text structures and phrases of humour

children.name: Language identification
children.definition: The task/process of guessing what natural language a text or text segment is written in

children.name: Contradiction detection
children.definition: The task/process of identifying conflicting statements (contradictions) in a dataset

children.name: Negation detection
children.definition: The task/process of identifying negative cues (words, phrases) in a text

children.name: Semantic reasoning
children.definition: The inferrence of logical consequences from a set of asserted facts or axioms [from wikipedia]

children.name: Named Entity Recognition
children.definition: A subtask of information extraction that seeks to locate and classify named entities in text into pre-defined categories such as the names of persons, organizations, locations, expressions of times, quantities, monetary values, percentages, etc.

children.name: Named Entity Disambiguation
children.definition: The task/process of selecting among candidate entities from a knowledge base (or other information resource) the ones to which the named entities in a text refer to

children.name: Entity mention recognition
children.definition: The task/process of detecting in a text mentions of a specific class of entities (e.g. biochemical entities, historical persons)

children.name: Term extraction
children.definition: The act/process of identifying and extracting candidate terms from a domain-specific corpus

children.name: Frame extraction
children.definition: The task of recognizing words and phrases that evoke semantic frames as defined in the FrameNet project, and their semantic dependents.

children.name: Extraction of domain-specific information
children.definition: Extraction of information that pertains to specific domains/disciplines; it can be used combined with "Annotation type" to specify the type of information extracted

children.name: Extraction of funding information
children.definition: The task/process of detecting in a text and extracting information relevant to funding (e.g. funding programme, award, funder etc.)

children.name: Natural Language Understanding
children.definition: The comprehension by computers of the structure and meaning of human languages, allowing users to interact with the computer using natural sentences. [adapted from https://www.gartner.com/it-glossary/nlu-natural-language-understanding]

children.name: Stance detection
children.definition: The extraction of a subject’s reaction to a claim made by a primary actor [http://nlpprogress.com/english/stance_detection.html]

children.name: Multimedia Information Extraction
children.definition: The process/task of automatically extracting structured information from multimedia data

children.name: Event detection
children.definition: The process/task of identifying events in data (text, video, images etc.), usually combined with their classification into types of events and recognition of the event attributes (e.g. time, place, participants and duration)

children.name: Computational argumentation
children.definition: The process/task of identifying and representing argumentation in text, so that systems have the ability to use them in tasks, such as automated logical reasoning

children.name: Author classification
children.definition: The task/process of organizing documents into groups/classes on the basis of their author

children.name: Emotion labelling
children.definition: The process/task of identifying types of feelings (e.g. anger, fear, happiness, sadness, etc.) in the linguistic expression of texts or facial expressions

children.name: Hate speech recognition
children.definition: The task of automatically identifying hate speech, i.e. statements intended to demean and brutalize another, or the use of cruel and derogatory language on the basis of real or alleged membership in a social group [adapted from wikipedia]

children.name: Age-bracket detection
children.definition: The task/process of identifying in a text a segment inside parentheses that describes an age group or age-related utterance

children.name: Persuasive expression mining
children.definition: The task/process of identifying and extracting (especially from political speech texts) pieces of text that aim to persuade

children.name: The task of identifying in a text segments expressing irony and classifying  them into types
Temporal expressions recognition
children.definition: The task/process of identifying temporal expressions (also called timex) in a text in order to extract temporal information

children.name: Answer Extraction
children.definition: The task/process where computer systems try to automatically answer questions posed by users in the form of natural language.

children.name: Rumours stance classification
children.definition: The task of identifying the attitude of a person towards the truthfulness of a rumour

children.name: Bot detection
children.definition: The task/process of identifying segments of text or speech discourse that have been uttered by bots

children.name: Information Retrieval
children.definition: The activity of obtaining information resources relevant to an information need from a collection of information resources; searches can be based on full-text or other content-based indexing

children.name: Semantic search
children.definition: A type of search that seeks to improve search accuracy by understanding the searcher's intent and the contextual meaning of terms as they appear in the searchable dataspace, whether on the Web or within a closed system, to generate more relevant results.

children.name: Multimedia Retrieval
children.definition: The activity of obtaining multimedia information resources relevant to an information need from a collection of multimedia information resources

children.name: Information filtering
children.definition: The process/task of removing (filtering out) redundant or unwanted information from an information stream using (semi)automated or computerized methods prior to presentation to a human user; the selection of the items is based on the correlation between the content of the items and the userâ€™s preferences (content-based filtering) or the correlation between people with similar preferences (collaborative filtering)

children.name: Information filtering by recommender systems
children.definition: The delivery of information in the form of suggestions by recommender systems; recommender systems seek to predict the ""rating"" or ""preference"" that a user would give to an item

children.name: Cross-language Information Retrieval
children.definition: The ability of a system to retrieve relevant documents in various languages in response to a user query that is formulated in only one language

children.name: Exploratory search
children.definition: A type of search which, in contrast to traditional lookup search, covers a broad class of activities, such as investigating, evaluating, comparing, and synthesizing

children.name: Knowledge Discovery
children.definition: The task/process of automatically searching large volumes of data for patterns that can be considered knowledge about the data

children.name: Recognizing Textual Entailment
children.definition: A task/process that intends to recognize for two text fragments whether the meaning of one text is entailed in that of the other, i.e. whether the truth of one text fragment follows from that of the other fragment.

children.name: Text categorization
children.definition: The task/process of assigning documents into classes or categories

children.name: Topic Detection
children.definition: The task/process of identifying the topic of a text or dataset (e.g. by clustering keywords or using topic models)

children.name: Sentiment analysis
children.definition: The process/task of computationally identifying and categorizing opinions expressed in a piece of text, especially in order to determine whether the writer's attitude towards a particular topic, product, etc. is positive, negative, or neutral

children.name: Answer Extraction
children.definition: The task/process where computer systems try to automatically answer questions posed by users in the form of natural language.

children.name: Knowledge Representation
children.definition: The task/process of representing information about entities in a form that machines are capable of understanding it

children.name: Image Understanding
children.definition: Advanced image processing in which artificial-intelligence techniques are used to interpret images by locating, characterizing, and recognizing objects and other features in the scene. [from https://www.encyclopedia.com/computing/dictionaries-thesauruses-pictures-and-press-releases/image-understanding]

children.name: Prediction
children.definition: In Machine Learning, it refers to the use of algorithms that learn from previous data in order to make predictions on data (by estimating probabilities from previous data)

children.name: Operation with multimedia input or output
Conversational systems building
children.definition: All activities related to the creation of conversational/dialogue systems (i.e. computer systems intended to converse with humans, through one or more communication modalities, such as text, speech, graphics, haptics, gestures)

children.name: Face recognition
children.definition: The task/process of identifying or verifying a person from a digital image or a video frame from a video source [adapted from Wikipedia]

children.name: Face verification
children.definition: The task/process of validating a claimed identity based on the image of a face, and either accepting or rejecting the identity claim [adapted from http://www.idiap.ch/~marcel/labs/faceverif.php]

children.name: Person identification
children.definition: A process that identifies an individual uniquely by using unique personal identification number (PIN) and/or biometrics like fingerprint, face recognition etc.

children.name: Text-to-Speech Synthesis
children.definition: The task/process of converting speech into natural language text

children.name: Document reading
children.definition: The task/process of converting the contents of a digital document into speech in order to aid mainly individuals with visual impairments

children.name: Sign language recognition
children.definition: The task/process of recognizing from images and videos hand gestures performed in sign language

children.name: Sign language generation
children.definition: The task/process of generating videos in sign language

children.name: Human Computer Interaction
children.definition: A multi-disciplinary research area focusing on the design and use of computer technology deployed in interfaces between humans and computers

children.name: Speech Recognition
children.definition: The use of computer hardware and software-based techniques to identify and process human voice used tused to identify the words a person has spoken or to authenticate the identity of the person speaking into the system [adapted from https://www.techopedia.com/definition/6044/automatic-speech-recognition-asr]

children.name: Lip tracking analysis
children.definition: The task/process of recognising the lip contour and tracking the movements of lips in lip reading

children.name: Speaker verification
children.definition: The task/process of verifying that a certain person is speaking

children.name: Phonetic transcription
children.definition: The visual representation of speech sounds (or phones)

children.name: Orthographic transcription
children.definition: The task/process of transcribing a source language word/phrase or an audio segment into the standard spelling system of a target language

children.name: Speech Enhancement
children.definition: The improvement of speech intelligibility by removing background noise from the speech signal

children.name: Speaker identification
children.definition: The task/process of identifying/recognizing who the person speaking is

children.name: Multimodal integration
children.definition: The study of how information from the different sensory modalities, such as sight, sound, touch, smell, self-motion and taste, may be integrated by the nervous system. [from Wikipedia]

children.name: Face detection
children.definition: The task/process of recognizing that a person appears on a digital image or a video frame from a video source and possibly marking the contours around it

children.name: Language Technology
children.definition: Language technology, often called human language technology, studies methods of how computer programs or electronic devices can analyze, produce, modify or respond to human texts and speech. It consists of natural language processing and computational linguistics on the one hand, and speech technology on the other. (from Wikipedia)

children.name: Validation
children.definition: The task/process of confirming that a system/data resource meets the specifications and fulfills its intended purpose

children.name: Visualization
children.definition: The representation of an object, situation, or set of information as a chart, diagram or any other image that helps end users understand the contents or message

children.name: Lexicon visualization
children.definition: The task/process of visualizing information (e.g. using diagrams, 3-d images, word clouds etc.) contained in lexical/conceptual resources

children.name: Content Mining
children.definition: The automated analysis of large volumes of content of any form or medium (e.g. text, images, videos, graphs, metadata etc.) that leads to the discovery of previously undiscovered information (e.g. identification of relationships between entities).

children.name: Annotation
children.definition: A note by way of explanation or comment added to a text or diagram [OED, https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/annotation]. Text or corpus annotation refers to the interpretative linguistic information grounded in a knowledge resource that is added manually or automatically to a text or corpus respectively.

children.name: Audio segmentation
children.definition: The task/process of partitioning audio stream into homogeneous segments and classifying them into speech and non-speech segments

children.name: Speaker diarization
children.definition: Partitioning of audio stream into homogeneous segments according to speaker properties and acoustic conditions

children.name: Annotation of speaker turns
children.definition: The task/process of marking locations in speech where there is a change of speakers

children.name: Paralanguage annotation
children.definition: The task/process of annotating paralinguistic features, i.e. vocal features that accompany speech and contribute to communication but are not generally considered to be part of the language system (e.g. vocal quality, loudness, and tempo); facial expressions and gestures are also considered as paralinguistic features [adapted from https://www.dictionary.com/browse/paralanguage]

children.name: Text annotation
children.definition: The process/task of adding annotations (notes or comments) to a text; in TDM, the annotations refer mainly to the interpretative linguistic information grounded in a knowledge resource that is added manually or automatically to a text

children.name: Semantic role labelling
children.definition: The task/process of attaching labels that correspond to the roles that the arguments of a predicate take in an event

children.name: Semantic class labelling
children.definition: The task/process of classifying words in a text according to a set of semantic classes (types).

children.name: Event labelling
children.definition: The process/act of marking events and classifying them into types of events in a text

children.name: Certainty level labelling
children.definition: The task/process of adding to statements in a text annotations that indicate the level of certainty of the author vis-a-vis the statement

children.name: Spatial role labelling
children.definition: Τhe task of identifying and classifying the spatial arguments of the spatial expressions mentioned in a sentence

children.name: Semantic relation labelling
children.definition: The task/process of attaching tags indicating the semantic relation that holds between units of a text.

children.name: Frame-semantic parsing
children.definition: The task/process of recognising and labelling in a text predicate argument structures and the semantic roles of the constituents, in accordance to the frame semantics theory.

children.name: Temporal expressions labelling
children.definition: The task/process of determining the boundaries of units of text that denote time-related concepts and attaching to them tags that name these concepts (e.g. date, time, duration etc.)

children.name: Annotation of dates
children.definition: The task/process of marking dates in a text

children.name: Annotation of question topics
children.definition: The task/process of attaching tags to the segment of a question that functions as the topic of that question

children.name: Entity linking
children.definition: The task/process of attaching tags to all the mentions of an entity in a text linking them together with the entity.

children.name: Polarity labelling
children.definition: The task/process of adding to units of a text (especially in sentiment-intensive texts) tags that indicate polarity (negative, positive, neutral, mixed)

children.name: Annotation of textual entailment
children.definition: The task/process of annotating textual entailments, most usually indicating whether a text entails or contradicts a hypothesis sentence or does neither.

children.name: Annotation of numbers
children.definition: The task/process of annotating numbers in a text

children.name: Annotation of measurements
children.definition: The task/process of annotating measurement expressions (e.g. of length, temperature, time, etc.)

children.name: Readability annotation
children.definition: The process/task of adding readability scores (or any other type of similar annotation) to a text or textual segment showing how easy it is to read and understand its meaning.

children.name: Morphosyntactic tagging
children.definition: The task/process of adding morphosyntactic tags to words in a text, i.e. part-of-speech and, optionally, morphological features per part-of-speech.

children.name: Part-of-Speech Tagging
children.definition: The task/process of marking words with the part of speech (word category, e.g. noun, verb etc.) to which they belong

children.name: Below Part-of-Speech Tagging
children.definition: The annotation of words with morphological information besides the part of speech and dependent upon it (e.g. for nouns: gender, number and case; for verbs: tense, number, person etc.)

children.name: Lemmatization
children.definition: Lemmatisation  (or lemmatization) in linguistics is the process of grouping together the inflected forms of a word so they can be analysed as a single item, identified by the word's lemma, or dictionary form. [Wikipedia]

children.name: Stemming
children.definition: The task/process of cutting off the ends of words (mainly inflectional affixes but sometimes also derivational affixes) aiming to relate words to a base form.

children.name: Structural annotation
children.definition: The task/process of segmenting a text and recognizing textual structural units (paragraphs, sentences, words etc.)

children.name: Tokenization
children.definition: The task/process of recognizing and tagging tokens (words, punctuation marks, digits etc.) in a text

children.name: Annotation of document structure
children.definition: The task/process of annotating the internal structure of a document (e.g. book chapters, sections in a journal article, title, preface, images/figures etc.)

children.name: Sentence splitting
children.definition: The task/process of recognizing and tagging sentence boundaries in a text

children.name: Paragraph splitting
children.definition: The task/process of segmenting a text into paragraphs and marking their boundaries

children.name: Parsing
children.definition: The task/process of recognizing and marking the syntactic structure of a text or text segment

children.name: Dependency parsing
children.definition: The task/process of identifying and marking the grammatical structure of a sentence, establishing relationships between ""head"" words and words that modify those heads

children.name: Chunking
children.definition: The task/process of dividing a sentence into chunks (non-overlapping text segments consisting of a head and preceding function words and/or modifiers)

children.name: Noun phrase chunking
children.definition: The task/process of identifying noun phrases in a sentence

children.name: Frame-semantic parsing
children.definition: The task/process of recognising and labelling in a text predicate argument structures and the semantic roles of the constituents, in accordance to the frame semantics theory.

children.name: Constituency parsing
children.definition: The task/process of identifying and marking constituents (phrases, governed by a head and including function words and/or modifiers ) in a text or text segment

children.name: Deep parsing
children.definition: The  task/process of building complete parse trees for a sentence [adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37020577/shallow-parsing-vs-deep-parsing-in-stanford-corenlp-java]

children.name: Morphological annotation
children.definition: The task/process of adding annotations pertaining to the morphological level of analysis (e.g. gender, number, person etc.)

children.name: Annotation of multi-word units
children.definition: The task/process of annotating multi-word units, i.e. combinations of words that are considered as one

children.name: Below Part-of-Speech Tagging
children.definition: The annotation of words with morphological information besides the part of speech and dependent upon it (e.g. for nouns: gender, number and case; for verbs: tense, number, person etc.)

children.name: Annotation of compounds
children.definition: The task/process of marking compounds (single words composed of two or more free morphemes) and their parts

children.name: Annotation of compounds
children.definition: The task/process of marking compounds (single words composed of two or more free morphemes) and their parts

children.name: Word segmentation
children.definition: The task/process of segmenting (cutting) a word into root and affixes

children.name: Annotation of derivational features
children.definition: The task/process of adding annotations relevant to the derivational level of analysis (e.g. recognizing derivational affixes, tagging their meaning etc.)

children.name: Syllable segmentation
children.definition: Segmentation of a word into syllables

children.name: Discourse annotation
children.definition: The task/process of adding annotations relevant to discourse, such as discourse structure, discourse markers etc.

children.name: Coreference annotation
children.definition: The task/process of attaching tags to a text unit and linking it to other text units that refer to the same entity in the world

children.name: Annotation of argumentation
children.definition: The task/process of marking argumentative structures, components and relations in a text

children.name: Discourse modelling
children.definition: The task/process of building discourse models

children.name: Anaphora annotation
children.definition: The process/task of marking all linguistic expressions that appear in a certain text or across texts as referring to the same entity and linking it to this entity

children.name: Support operation for knowledge resources
children.definition: Any operation that intends to support the creation, curation or use of knowledge resource

children.name: Lexicon enhancement
children.definition: The task/process of improving (e.g. increasing the size of entries, improving the information, adding new types of information, etc.) a lexicon

children.name: Lexicon merging
children.definition: The task/process of merging (combining together) information coming from various lexical/conceptual resources

children.name: Lexicon creation
children.definition: The task/process of constructing lexical resources (e.g. dictionaries, computational lexica, glossaries, etc.)

children.name: Lexicon extraction from lexica
children.definition: The task/process of constructing lexical resources based on the restructuring of lexical information contained in lexica (e.g. by parsing definitions or using syntactic information attached to lemmas)

children.name: Lexicon access
children.definition: The task/process of accessing lexical/conceptual resources (either by humans or computer programs)

children.name: Bilingual lexicon induction
children.definition: The task/process of inducing word translations from monolingual or comparable corpora in two languages

children.name: Lexicon viewing
children.definition: The task/process of viewing the contents of a lexicon as performed by human beings

children.name: Lexicon format conversion
children.definition: The task/process of converting the format of a lexical/conceptual resource into another (e.g. from TSV to XML)

children.name: Lexicon visualization
children.definition: The task/process of visualizing information (e.g. using diagrams, 3-d images, word clouds etc.) contained in lexical/conceptual resources

children.name: Lexicon acquisition from corpora
children.definition: The task/process of constructing lexical resources from corpora

children.name: Support operation
children.definition: Any operation that is used to support LT tasks, either for creating workflows or for executing them

children.name: Document image analysis
children.definition: The processing of images of documents in order to obtain a machine-readable description of the their contents and structure from the pixel data [adapted from https://www.ias.ac.in/article/fulltext/sadh/027/01/0003-0022]

children.name: Feature extraction
children.definition: Feature extraction consists in transforming arbitrary data, such as text or images, into numerical features usable for machine learning

children.name: Editing
children.definition: The task/process of changing the contents of a resource

children.name: Evaluation
children.definition: The task/process of assessing the quality of a resource, e.g. based on the contents (for a dataset) or performance (for a tool or service)

children.name: Deep parser performance evaluation
children.definition: The task/process of measuring the speed and accuracy of deep parsers with respect to a manually parsed test corpus.

children.name: Evaluation of broad-coverage natural language parsers
children.definition: The task/process of assessing the quality performance of parsers

children.name: Evaluation of Machine Translation and translation tools
children.definition: The task/process of assessing the quality performance of machine translation tools

children.name: Format conversion
children.definition: The task/process of converting (changing) the format of a resource into another (e.g. PDF to TXT or XML)

children.name: Dependency conversion
children.definition: The task/process of converting constituency structures to dependency trees

children.name: Lexicon format conversion
children.definition: The task/process of converting the format of a lexical/conceptual resource into another (e.g. from TSV to XML)

children.name: Linguistic analysis
children.definition: Any operation that aims at the analysis of language or its structure

children.name: Discourse analysis
children.definition: A method of analysing the structure of texts or utterances longer than one sentence, taking into account both their linguistic content and their sociolinguistic context; analysis performed using this method.[OED, https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/discourse_analysis]

children.name: Anaphora resolution
children.definition: The process/task of identifying all linguistic expressions that appear in a certain text or across texts and refer to the same entity

children.name: Parsing
children.definition: The task/process of recognizing and marking the syntactic structure of a text or text segment

children.name: Dependency parsing
children.definition: The task/process of identifying and marking the grammatical structure of a sentence, establishing relationships between ""head"" words and words that modify those heads

children.name: Chunking
children.definition: The task/process of dividing a sentence into chunks (non-overlapping text segments consisting of a head and preceding function words and/or modifiers)

children.name: Noun phrase chunking
children.definition: The task/process of identifying noun phrases in a sentence

children.name: Frame-semantic parsing
children.definition: The task/process of recognising and labelling in a text predicate argument structures and the semantic roles of the constituents, in accordance to the frame semantics theory.

children.name: Constituency parsing
children.definition: The task/process of identifying and marking constituents (phrases, governed by a head and including function words and/or modifiers ) in a text or text segment

children.name: Deep parsing
children.definition: The  task/process of building complete parse trees for a sentence [adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37020577/shallow-parsing-vs-deep-parsing-in-stanford-corenlp-java]

children.name: Morphological analysis
children.definition: The analysis of the structure of words and their relations to other words as regards their form and derivation

children.name: Co-reference resolution
children.definition: The process/task of identifying all linguistic expressions that appear in a certain text or across texts and refer to the same unique entity in the world

children.name: Derivational analysis
children.definition: The analysis of a word in order to identify its derivation, i.e. whether and how it has been formed on the basis of another word (e.g. through the use of affixes)

children.name: Facial expression recognition
children.definition: The task/process of detecting emotions on human face based on biometric markers [adapted from https://sightcorp.com/knowledge-base/facial-expression-recognition/]

children.name: Pseudonymization
children.definition: The processing of personal data in such a way that the data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject without the use of additional information (from GDPR)

children.name: Debugging
children.definition: The task/process of removing errors from a computer programme

children.name: Word Sense Disambiguation
children.definition: The process/task of identifying which sense of a word with multiple meanings is used in a particular context; the selection of the sense is made from a list of the word's senses.

children.name: Language Modelling
children.definition: The construction of statistical or Machine Learning language models

children.name: Training of language models
children.definition: The task/process of training (statistical) language models that  that can estimate the distribution of natural language as accurately as possible.

children.name: Training of Machine Learning models
children.definition: The task/process of creating Machine Learning (ML) models by providing a ML algorithm with training data that help the algorithm discover patterns in data, and construct the appropriate models using these discoveries

children.name: Dialogue modelling
children.definition: The task/process of building models of dialogues to be used in dialogue systems

children.name: Support of crowdsourcing tasks
children.definition: Any operation that can support tasks that are accomplished through crowdsourcing

children.name: Data merging
children.definition: The task/process of merging (combining) together data from various sources

children.name: Paraphrasing
children.definition: A task/process whereby a text fragment is reproduced with another text fragment that conveys the same or similar information

children.name: Building of finite state automata
children.definition: The task/process of creating Finite State Automata (a mathematical model of computation)

children.name: Language identification
children.definition: The task/process of guessing what natural language a text or text segment is written in

children.name: Script-based analysis
children.definition: The task/process of analysing a resource following a script

children.name: Document comparison
children.definition: The task/process of comparing different versions of the same document

children.name: Handwriting recognition
children.definition: The ability of a computer to receive and interpret intelligible handwritten input from sources such as paper documents, photographs, touch-screens and other devices [from Wikipedia]

children.name: Data splitting
children.definition: The task/process of splitting (partitioning) available data into parts, usually for cross-validatory purposes, e.g. in order to use one part for training purposes and the other for evaluation.

children.name: Validation
children.definition: The task/process of confirming that a system/data resource meets the specifications and fulfills its intended purpose

children.name: Corpus management
children.definition: The task/process of managing corpora, e.g. creating, viewing, etc. through an integrated environment

children.name: Management of annotations
children.definition: The task/process of managing (manually or (semi-)automatically) annotated texts, distributing them among annotators and monitoring their work

children.name: Visualization
children.definition: The representation of an object, situation, or set of information as a chart, diagram or any other image that helps end users understand the contents or message

children.name: Lexicon visualization
children.definition: The task/process of visualizing information (e.g. using diagrams, 3-d images, word clouds etc.) contained in lexical/conceptual resources

children.name: Comment filtering
children.definition: The identification and removal of abusive, bullying, etc. comments from texts

children.name: Machine translation support
children.definition: Any operation that can be used for training or support of Machine Translation tools

children.name: Parallel sentence extraction
children.definition: The task/process of identifying parallel sentences (i.e. sentences that have the same sense in different languages) in parallel texts

children.name: Alignment
children.definition: Establishment of translational equivalences between structural units (words, sentences etc.) of a text in a given language and a text with similar meaning in other language(s)

children.name: Sentence alignment
children.definition: Alignment at sentence level

children.name: Word alignment
children.definition: Alignment at word level

children.name: Phrase alignment
children.definition: Alignment at phrase level

children.name: Normalization
children.definition: The task/process of editing a text in order to remove unwanted material (e.g. quotation marks, hyphenations etc.) or to substitute/represent specific items (tokens, dates,  etc.) with normalized values

children.name: Concept normalization
children.definition: The task of mapping free-form expressions to the concepts of a specific domain

children.name: Biomedical concept normalization
children.definition: The task of mapping free-form expressions to medical terms [source: Medical concept normalization in social media posts with recurrent neural networks]

children.name: Normalization of numbers
children.definition: The task/process of substituting numbers with normalized values

children.name: Normalization of measurements
children.definition: The task/process of substituting measurements with normalized values

children.name: Viewing
children.definition: The task/process of viewing the contents of a resource as performed by human beings

children.name: Corpus viewing
children.definition: The task/process of viewing the contents of a corpus as performed by human beings

children.name: Lexicon viewing
children.definition: The task/process of viewing the contents of a lexicon as performed by human beings

children.name: Data collection
children.definition: The process of gathering and measuring information on targeted variables in an established systematic fashion, which then enables one to answer relevant questions and evaluate outcomes.

children.name: Web crawling
children.definition: The use of bots that crawl the web (crawlers) in order to spot content that matches user-set criteria and download them to create large datasets

children.name: Optical Character Recognition
children.definition: The task/process of converting handwritten or printed material into machine editable text

children.name: Word sense induction
children.definition: The task of automatically identifying the senses of a word

children.name: Matching
children.definition: The task/performance of identifying similar elements in two resources

children.name: Gazeteer based matching
children.definition: The task/process of performing a comparison between a text/dataset and a gazeteer and identifying in the text/dataset units that are included in the gazeteer

children.name: Resource access
children.definition: Any operation that enables accessing a resource

children.name: Reading
children.definition: Getting access to the contents of an input resource

children.name: Writing
children.definition: The task/process of producing the output results of a process/workflow in various formats

children.name: Anonymization
children.definition: The task/process through which particular text segments or data units that allow the identification of a person are removed or replaced

children.name: Data masking
children.definition: The process of hiding original data with modified content (characters or other data) in order to protect data classified as personal identifiable data, or sensitive data [adapted from Wikipedia]

children.name: Natural Language Generation
children.definition: The task/process of generating natural language text from some non-linguistic representation of information.

children.name: Multilingual generation
children.definition: The task/process of generating content in multiple languages

children.name: Summarization
children.definition: The process/task of reducing one or more textual documents with a computer program in order to create a summary that retains the most important points of the original document(s).

children.name: Lexical substitution
children.definition: The task of identifying a substitute for a word in the context of a clause [from Wikipedia]

children.name: Text-to-Speech Synthesis
children.definition: The task/process of converting speech into natural language text

children.name: Document reading
children.definition: The task/process of converting the contents of a digital document into speech in order to aid mainly individuals with visual impairments

children.name: Automatic subtitling
children.definition: The task/process of automatically adding subtitles to a video

children.name: Sign language generation
children.definition: The task/process of generating videos in sign language

children.name: Lexical simplification
children.definition: The task of replacing individual words of a text with words that are easier to understand, so that the text as a whole becomes easier to comprehend, e.g. by people with learning disabilities or by children who learn to read [from https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-642-28601-8_36]

children.name: Text simplification
children.definition: The task of replacing textual segments (phrases, clauses, etc.) with other segments that have similar meaning but are easier to understand

children.name: Conjugation
children.definition: The act of generating (listing in a prescribed order) the various inflectional forms of a word

children.name: Authoring support
children.definition: The task/process of providing spelling, grammatical or stylistic suggestions as an aid for the authoring task

children.name: Spell checking
children.definition: The task/process of checking the accuracy of spelling of a word (and usually correcting it) according to the accepted form

children.name: Language checking
children.definition: The task/process of identifying (and usually correcting) grammatical mistakes in a text

children.name: TDM Method
children.definition: The method used by a TDM algorithm

children.name: Machine Learning Method
children.definition: A method of data analysis that automates model building. Using algorithms that iteratively learn from data, machine learning allows computers to find hidden insights without being explicitly programmed where to look.

children.name: Machine and Statistical Learning Method
children.definition: Methods and techniques used either in machine learning or statistical learning

children.name: Regularisation
children.definition: A process of introducing additional information in order to solve an ill-posed problem or to prevent overfitting.

children.name: Dimensionality Reduction
children.definition: A method based on reducing the number of random variables under consideration, via obtaining a set of principal variables.

children.name: Decision Trees
children.definition: A non-parametric supervised learning method used for classification and regression. The goal is to create a tree-like graph or model of decisions and their possible consequences by learning simple decision rules inferred from the data features.

children.name: Kernel Method
children.definition: Any method used in pattern analysis that relies on kernel functions, which enable it to operate in a high-dimensional, implicit feature space without ever computing the coordinates of the data in that space, but rather by simply computing the inner products between the images of all pairs of data in the feature space.

children.name: Artificial Neural Network
children.definition: A computational model based on a large collection of simple neural units (artificial neurons), loosely analogous to the observed behavior of a biological brain's axons. These systems are self-learning and trained, rather than explicitly programmed.

children.name: Association Rule Learning
children.definition: A machine learning method used in recognising relationships among variables in databases and extracted in the form of rules.

children.name: Regression Analysis
children.definition: A statistical process for estimating the relationships among variables. It includes many techniques for modeling and analyzing several variables, when the focus is on the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables (or 'predictors').

children.name: Clustering Method
children.definition: Any method used in clustering or cluster analysis, i.e. in grouping a set of objects in such a way that objects in the same group (cluster) are more similar (in some sense or another) to each other than to those in other groups (clusters).

children.name: Ensemble Method
children.definition: Any method that uses multiple learning algorithms in an attempt to improve predictive performance not obtainable otherwise with any of the constituent learning algorithms.

children.name: Instance-based Learning
children.definition: A family of learning algorithms that, instead of performing explicit generalization, compares new problem instances with instances seen in training, which have been stored in memory.

children.name: Bayesian
children.definition: A method in probability and statistics based on Bayes' theorem, mainly related to statistical inference.

children.name: Deep Learning
children.definition: A branch of machine learning based on deep neural networks. A deep neural network (DNN) is an artificial neural network (ANN) with multiple hidden layers of units between the input and output layers.

children.name: Finite state technology
children.definition: In data communications, flow control is the process of managing the rate of data transmission between two nodes to prevent a fast sender from overwhelming a slow receiver. It provides a mechanism for the receiver to control the transmission speed, so that the receiving node is not overwhelmed with data from transmitting node.

children.name: Statistical Learning Method
children.definition: The process of using statistics and techniques related to statistics in order to understand and learn from your data so that you can predict its future.

children.name: Rule-based Method
children.definition: A type of method that makes use of set(s) of rules to perform the relevant task.

children.name: Crowdsourcing
children.definition: The practice of obtaining needed services, ideas, or content by soliciting contributions from a large group of people and especially from the online community rather than from traditional employees or suppliers
